Question                                               Answers                                                           Notes                 Total
1   a   i    1 2                                                                                             Award GPE lost
               v = 0.24 gh 
             2                                                                                               = 65 × 9.81 × 30 = «19130 J » .
             v = 11.9 «m s−1»                                                                               Must see the 11.9 value for        2
                                                                                                             MP2, not simply 12.
                                                                                                             Allow g = 9.8 ms-2.

    a   ii   internal energy is the total KE «and PE» of the molecules/particles/atoms in an object         Award [1 max] if there is no
             temperature is a measure of the average KE of the molecules/particles/atoms                    mention of                         2
                                                                                                             molecules/particles/atoms.

    b   i    arrow vertically downwards from dot labelled weight/W/mg/gravitational force/Fg/Fgravitational Do not allow gravity.
             AND arrow vertically upwards from dot labelled reaction force/R/normal contact force/N/FN  Do not award MP1 if
             W>R                                                                                           additional ‘centripetal’ force
                                                                                                            arrow is added.
                                                                                                             Arrows must connect to dot.
                                                                                                             Ignore any horizontal arrow        2
                                                                                                             labelled friction.
                                                                                                             Judge by eye for MP2.
                                                                                                             Arrows do not have to be
                                                                                                             correctly labelled or connect
                                                                                                             to dot for MP2.

Question                                                 Answers                                                          Notes                Total
1   b   ii   ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                                     Do not award a mark for the
                                                                                                               bald statement that the skier
                                                                mv2
             recognition that centripetal force is required /       seen                                      does not lose contact with
                                                                 r                                             the ground.
             = 468 «N» 
             W/640 N (weight) is larger than the centripetal force required, so the skier does not lose
             contact with the ground 
             ALTERNATIVE 2
                                                                       v2
             recognition that centripetal acceleration is required /      seen 
                                                                       r
             a = 7.2 «m s–2» 
             g is larger than the centripetal acceleration required, so the skier does not lose contact with
             the ground                                                                                                                        3

             ALTERNATIVE 3
             recognition that to lose contact with the ground centripetal force ≥ weight 
             calculation that v ≥ 14 «ms-1» 
             comment that 12 «ms-1» is less than 14 «ms-1» so the skier does not lose contact with the
             ground 
             ALTERNATIVE 4
                                                                mv2
             recognition that centripetal force is required /       seen 
                                                                 r
             calculation that reaction force = 172 «N» 
             reaction force > 0 so the skier does not lose contact with the ground 

Question                                                Answers                                                        Notes               Total
2   a        when 2 waves meet the resultant displacement                                                  Displacement should be
             is the «vector» sum of their individual displacements                                         mentioned at least once in      2
                                                                                                            MP 1 or 2.

    b             4.7 × 10 −3 × 0.35 × 10 −3                                                                Allow missed powers of 10
             λ=                                                                                            for MP1.
                             2.4
                                                                                                                                            3
           = 6.9 × 10 −7 «m» 
             answer to 2 SF 

    c        green wavelength smaller than red                                                             Allow ECF from MP1.
                                                                                                                                            2
             fringe separation / distance between maxima decreases 

    d        bright central maximum                                                                        Allow marks from a suitably
             subsidiary maxima «on either side»                                                            labelled intensity graph for
                                                                                                            single slit diffraction.

             the width of the central fringe is twice / larger than the width of the subsidiary/secondary
             fringes/maxima                                                                                                                2 max
             OR
             intensity of pattern is decreased 

             efficiency «   =   » 0.27 / 27% 

                                                                                                        incorrect radius)

             not all KE of air can be transferred to KE of blades                                       turbine is not zero.

        = 0.028 «Ω» 

                                   34 « W »                                                                   Allow 35 – 36 W if unrounded
                                                                                                               figures for R or I are used.
                                                                                                                                               1
                                                                                                               Allow ECF from (a)(i) and
                                                                                                               (a)(ii).

    b          «as temperature increases» there is greater vibration of the metal atoms/lattice/lattice ions   Award [0] for suggestions
                                                                                                               that the speed of electrons
               OR
                                                                                                               increases so resistance
               increased collisions of electrons                                                              decreases.                      3
               drift velocity decreases «so current decreases» 
               «as V constant so» R increases 

    c          recognition that power = flow rate × c ∆T                                                      Allow MP4 if a bald flow

Question                                                 Answers                                                       Notes              Total
5   a         Meson: quark-antiquark pair 
                                                                                                                                            2
              Baryon: 3 quarks 

    b   i     Alternative 1                                                                                 Do not allow a bald answer
              strange quark changes «flavour» to an up quark                                               of weak interaction.

              changes in quarks/strangeness happen only by the weak interaction 
              Alternative 2
                                                                                                                                            2
              Strangeness is not conserved in this decay «because the strange quark changes to an up
              quark» 
              Strangeness is not conserved during the weak interaction 


        ii    arrows drawn in the direction shown                                                          Both needed for [1] mark.



                                                                                                                                            1




        iii   W−                                                                                           Do not allow W or W+.           1

    c         it lowers the cost to individual nations, as the costs are shared                            Any one.
              international co-operation leads to international understanding OR historical example of
              co-operation OR co-operation always allows science to proceed 
                                                                                                                                          1 max
              large quantities of data are produced that are more than one institution/research group can
              handle 
              co-operation allows effective analysis\collaboration of able scientists 

                                                                                                                                           2
           and in the opposite direction/directed towards equilibrium 

           T would be smaller 
                                                                                                                                           3
           fractional uncertainty in T would be greater, so fractional uncertainty of mass of block would
           be greater 

Question                                               Answers                                   Notes                 Total
  e   i    left                                                                                                        1

      ii   coils to the right of P move right and the coils to the left move left    Do not allow a bald statement
           hence P at centre of rarefaction                                          of rarefaction or answers that
                                                                                      don’t include reference to the
                                                                                      movement of coils.                2
                                                                                      Allow ECF from MP1 if the
                                                                                      movement of the coils imply a
                                                                                      compression.

Question                                                Answers                                                     Notes             Total
8   a        the size of the induced emf                                                                The word ‘induced’ is
             is proportional/equal to the rate of change of flux linkage                                required here.
                                                                                                         Allow correctly defined
                                                                                                                                        2
                                                                                                         symbols from a correct
                                                                                                         equation. ‘Induced’ is
                                                                                                         required for MP1.

    b   i    varying voltage/current in primary coil produces a varying magnetic field                  Comparison of number of
             this produces a change in flux linkage / change in magnetic field in the secondary coil    turns is required for MP4.
                                                                                                                                        4
             a «varying» emf is induced/produced/generated in the secondary coil 
             voltage is stepped down as there are more turns on the primary than the secondary 

    b   ii                      90 × 240
             output voltage =            
                                 1800
                                                                                                                                        2
             = 12 « V » 

    c        laminated core reduces eddy currents ü
                                                                                                                                        2
             less thermal energy is transferred to the surroundings ü

    d        for a certain power to be transmitted, large V means low I ü
                                                                                                                                        2
             less thermal energy loss as P = I 2R / joule heatingü
                                                                              – 15 –                                      M17/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


Question                                                   Answers                                                          Notes                   Total
9   a         Observation 1:
              particle – photon energy is below the work function
              OR
              E = h f and energy is too small «to emit electrons» 

              wave – the energy of an em wave is independent of frequency                                                                           4
              Observation 2:
              particle – a single electron absorbs the energy of a single photon «in an almost instantaneous
              interaction» 
              wave – it would take time for the energy to build up to eject the electron 

    b   i                                                  4.2 × 10 −19                                        Do not allow a bald answer of
              attempt to calculate gradient of graph = «                »                                     6.63 x 10-34 Js or 6.6 x 10-34 Js.
                                                           6.2 × 1014                                                                                2
              = 6.8 − 6.9 × 10 −34 «Js» 

        ii    ALTERNATIVE 1
              minimum energy required to remove an electron «from the metal surface» 
                                                                                                                                                     1
              ALTERNATIVE 2
              energy required to remove the least tightly bound electron «from the metal surface» 

        iii   ALTERNATIVE 1
              reading of y intercept from graph in range 3.8 – 4.2 × 10 −19 «J» 
              conversion to eV = 2.4 – 2.6 «e V » 
              ALTERNATIVE 2                                                                                                                          2
              reading of x intercept from graph «5.8 - 6.0 × 10 Hz» and using h f 0 to get
                                                                 14


              3.8 – 4.2 × 10 −19 «J» 
              conversion to eV = 2.4 – 2.6 «e V » 

                                                                                         2
           to the right of the existing line 
